SUBJECT: Buyback
DETAILS: Tech Mahindra Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on February 21,2019 has Approved the proposal for buyback by the Company of its own fully paid equity shares of Rs. 5/- each ("Equity Shares") not exceeding 20,585,000 Equity Shares (being 2.10% of the total paid-up equity capital of the Company) from the equity shareholders of the Company as on 6th March, 2019 ("Record Date") at a price of Rs. 950 /- (Rupees Nine Hundred Fifty only) per Equity Share ("Buyback Offer Price"), for an aggregate amount not exceeding Rs. 1,956 crore (Rupees One Thousand Nine Hundred and Fifty Six Crores Only) (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyback Offer Size") (being less than 10% of the total paid-up equity capital and free reserves of the Company as on December 31, 2018) from the shareholders of the Company on a proportionate basis through the tender offer route (hereinafter referred to as the "Buybackￂﾔ) in accordance and consonance with the provisions contained in the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Buy-Back of Securities) Regulations, 2018 (as amended) ("Buyback Regulations") and the Companies Act, 2013 ("Act") (including any statutory modification(s) or re-enactment of the Act or the rules made thereunder, for the time being in force). The Buyback Offer Size does not include any expenses incurred or to be incurred for the Buyback such as filing fees payable to SEBI, advisorsￂﾒ fees, transaction costs viz. brokerage, applicable taxes such as securities

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Tech Mahindra Limited with respect to an announcement dated May 26, 2015 , that "The Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 26, 2015 have, inter alia, considered and approved the proposal for amalgamation of Tech Mahindra BPO Limited and New vC Services Private Limited, wholly owned subsidiaries, with Tech Mahindra Limited and their Shareholders and Creditors under the provisions of Sections 391 to 394 and other applicable provisions of the Companies Act , 1956 (including any statutory modification or re-enactment or amendment thereof) as per terms and conditions mentioned in the Scheme of Amalgamation placed before the Board" The Company has clarified as follows:  1. Area of business of entities:  a. Tech Mahindra BPO Ltd is currently engaged in executing Business Process Outsourcing contracts for their clients in India and abroad, for their operating and management processes.  b. New vC Services Ltd is currently engaged in business of providing online technical support for all processes, transactions, activities and all other work performed by business in various industries within India and across the world.  2. Rationale for Amalgamation:  The amalgamation of the Transferor Companies with the Transferee Company would inter alia have the following benefits:  i. Greater integration and greater financial strength and flexibility for the amalgamated entity and strengthening position in the industry, in terms of the asset base, revenues, service range;  ii. Improved organizational capability and leadership, arising from the combination of human capital who collectively have diverse skills, talent and vast experience to compete successfully in an increasingly competitive industry;  iii. The combination of the businesses would increase the long term value for shareholders and investors;  iv. Benefits of operational synergies in terms of economies of scale, more focused operational efforts, rationalization, standardization and simplification of business processes and productivity improvements;  v. Simplified corporate structure.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: the Exchange had sought clarification from Tech Mahindra Limited with respect to an announcement dated January 09, 2015, regarding press release dated January 09, 2015 "Tech Mahindra Augments Its Core Banking Expertise; to acquire SOFGEN Holdings Limited". The Company has clarified as follows:   a) Whether the promoter/ promoter group/ group companies have any interest in the entity being acquired? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof;   Company Response: No  b) Whether the acquisition would fall within related party transactions? If yes, whether the same is done at  arm s length;   Company Response: Not applicable  c) Brief details of any governmental or regulatory approvals required for the acquisition;   Company Response: RBI approval is required before investment  d) Indicative time period for completion of the acquisition;   Company Response: Probably March 31, 2015.  e) Estimated cost of acquisition or the price at which the shares are acquired;   Company Response: upto US$ 30 Mn.  f) Nature of consideration - whether cash consideration or share swap and details of the same;   Company Response: Only cash consideration  g) Percentage of shareholding / control acquired and / or number of shares acquired;   Company Response: 100%  h) date of incorporation of entity, history of last 3 years turnover, country in which the acquired entity has presence and any other significant information (in brief)  Company Response: SOFGEN Holdings was incorporated in 1999 in Geneva, Switzerland. The last three years turnover is US$ 35.7 mn, 39.9 mn and 43 mn for 2011, 2012 and 2013 respectively.

Response from the Company is awaited.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from Tech Mahindra Limited with respect to a news item captioned "Satyam Scam: Tech Mahindra let off". The Company has clarified that "Subsequent to the approval of the merger of Satyam Computers Services limited (SCSL) with Tech Mahindra Limited (Tech Mahindra), Tech Mahindra became a party to the prosecution initiated against SCSL and others by the Joint Director, Directorate of Enforcement, Hyderabad against the SCSL, its erstwhile promoters and others under the Prevention of Money-Laundering Act, 2002 ("Act") for alleged contravention of the Act.  Against the above prosecution, Tech Mahindra had moved a Writ Application before The Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Hyderabad for the State of Telangana and the State of Andhra Pradesh challenging the prosecution against erstwhile SCSL (since merged with Tech Mahindra). Upon hearing the matter, the Hon'ble High Court pronounced its order/ judgment in the open court quashing the proceedings against Tech Mahindra. The Company is awaiting the order copy in this regard".

N. Manoharan and Mrs. M. Rajyalakshmi Rao who were Directors of Mahindra Satyam, as Additional Directors of the Company with effect from July 01, 2013. (2) The resignations of Hon. Akash Paul, Mr. B. H. Wani and Dr. Raj Reddy, Directors of the Company. (3) The letter received from Mr. Paul Zuckerman, Director whose office is liable to retire by rotation at the ensuing Annual General Meeting, expressing his intention not to seek reappointment in the ensuing Annual General Meeting of the Company. (4) Mr. G. Jayaraman as the Company Secretary and Chief Compliance Officer of the Company with effect from July 01, 2013.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Tech Mahindra Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on November 05, 2012, inter alia, has taken the following decision " The Board noted that British Telecommunications Plc. (BT) had sold a substantial portion of its shares in the Company as a result of which BT's shareholding in the Company had fallen below 10%. The Board noted that in terms of the Shareholders Agreement (SHA) between Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd. (M & M) & BT to which the Company was also a party has ceased to be operative. Consequently, Mr. Anand Mahindra & Mr. Bharat Doshi who were nominated by M&M on the Board of the Company will vacate their office of director. In view of this the Board appointed Mr. Anand Mahindra & Mr. Bharat Doshi as additional directors & Mr. Anand Mahindra was elected as the Chairman of the Company.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Tech Mahindra Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the provisions of Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 read with the Companies (Passing of Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001, the Company is seeking consent of its members through Special Resolution proposed to be passed through Postal Ballot in respect of the following business: Amendment to Article 106 of the Articles of Association of the Company to increase the maximum number of Directors from twelve (12) to fifteen (15). The Company has appointed Mr. Jayavant B. Bhave, Company Secretary in Whole-time Practice as a Scrutinizer for conducting the Postal Ballot in a fair and transparent manner and in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Act, 1956. The duly completed postal ballot forms should reach the scrutinizer on or before March 07, 2009. The Scrutinizer will submit his report to the Chairman after completion of the scrutiny of the Postal Ballots received. The Chairman and in his absence, any person authorized by the Chairman will announce the Results of the Postal Ballot on March 10, 2009. The copy of the Notice of Postal Ballot shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that Tech Mahindra Limited  has bagged a $700 million contract from British Telecom (BT). The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. Tech Mahindra Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated,  "We are often in discussions/negotiations with multiple customers/prospects to secure business. We are currently in exclusive discussions with BT to secure a contract in relation to a potential transaction but we have not entered into any $700m contract with BT as reported by the media. We are also bound by confidentiality obligations in relation to the contracts under negotiation."

DETAILS: Tech Mahindra Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the following decisions taken at the meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held on October 18,2006: 1) The Board has issued and allotted 145,970 equity shares of Rs. 10/- of the Company, on exercise of stock options under Employee Stock Option Plan 2000 (ESOP 2000) of the Company. 2) The Board has convened an Extra-ordinary General Meeting of the shareholders of the Company on November 30,2006 for ratifying a pre-IPO Employee Stock Option Scheme of the Company, post IPO.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Tech Mahindra Limited has informed the Exchange regarding a press release dated October 18,2006, titled "Tech Mahindra Q2 net up 373 %". The details of the press release shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements).
